cinnamon.engine.utils

Interface LockingSpacePartitioningTree<E>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - element to partition.
    All Superinterfaces:
    SpacePartitioningTree<E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BinaryBVH

    public interface LockingSpacePartitioningTree<E>
extends SpacePartitioningTree<E>

    Variant of SpacePartitioningTree mandating that Bounds in use are locked from use by any other tree instance across implementations of this interface. LockingSpacePartitionTrees are not intended to be implemented outside of cinnamon.engine.utils.

    Exclusivity

    Adding a Bounds that has not yet been added to a LockingSpacePartitioningTree will make the Bounds' isExclusivelyPartitioned() return true. Attempting to add the same Bounds to another locking tree instance will cause add(Bounds, Object) to throw an exception unless the Bounds is first removed from the tree that contains it.

    Whether or not a Bounds has been locked does not affect its use in non-locking SpacePartitioningTrees.

        contains, containsElement, equals, getContained, getContained, getElement, getIntersections, getIntersections, getIntersections, getIntersections, hashCode, isEmpty, size, update, update

    • Method Detail

      • add

        boolean add(Bounds bounds,
            E element)

        Adds a Bounds-element pair.

        Successfully adding a Bounds to the tree will cause bounds.isExclusivelyPartitioned() to return true and prevent the Bounds from being added to another LockingSpacePartitioningTree.

        Specified by:
        add in interface SpacePartitioningTree<E>
        Parameters:
        bounds - element's simplified volume.
        element - to partition.
        Returns:
        true if the pair was successfully added, false if already in the partition.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if bounds or element is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the bounds is already inside a LockingSpacePartitioningTree.

      • clear

        void clear()

        Removes all Bounds elements.

        All Bounds are released and calling bounds.isExclusivelyPartitioned() on any of the removed Bounds will return false. After this method executes, these Bounds are free to be added to other LockingSpacePartitioningTrees.

        Specified by:
        clear in interface SpacePartitioningTree<E>

      • remove

        E remove(Bounds bounds)

        Removes a Bounds and its element.

        Successfully removing a Bounds from the tree will release this tree's lock and cause bounds.isExclusivelyPartitioned() to return false. After this method executes, the Bounds can be added to another LockingSpacePartitioningTree.

        Specified by:
        remove in interface SpacePartitioningTree<E>
        Parameters:
        bounds - element's simplified volume.
        Returns:
        element associated with bounds, or null if nothing was removed.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if bounds is null.
